intro: Melampyrum lineare subvar. brachycladum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are linear and often clustered near the base of the plant, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. This subspecies is noted for its parasitic nature, relying on the roots of other plants for nutrients.
